name: St. Basil the Great
summary: Basil of Caesarea, also called Saint Basil the Great, was a bishop of Caesarea Mazaca in Cappadocia, Asia Minor. He was an influential theologian who supported the Nicene Creed and opposed the heresies of the early Christian church.
keyQuotes: The bread which you do not use is the bread of the hungry; the garment hanging in your wardrobe is the garment of him who is naked.
